. It was originally Etruscan and then fell under Roman influence, when it became an important agricultural area. In the Middle Ages its good fortifications made it a prized asset and it was much fought over.
Corciano is close to the main highway that links Perugia with
and the A1 North-South Autostrada. It can be reached by train from Terontola, connecting there with trains from
and the line continues to Perugia and

content=Throughout the month of December the community of Corciano presents a town-wide Nativity. Life-size statutes created by local artists and community members recreate the Nativity in the setting of the Medieval city with many tableaux ranging from artisan workshops and towns people, to of course the stable of the Nativity.
directions=on the corso, adjacent to Piazza Caduti

content=The Palazzo Municipale was constructed in the 16th century by the dukes of the Della Corgna family, a noble family of Perugia, to consolidate their power over the formerly independent community.
directions=on the Corso, adjacent to Piazza Caduti

content=The Palazzo Municipale, today the seat of the government of the Commune of Corciano, was constructed in the 16th century by the dukes of the  Della Corgna family to consolidate Perugia's power over the formerly independent city. Some rooms are open to the public and include 16th century frescoed ceilings.

content=At the end of June, Corciano celebrates its traditional food festival, or "sagra". Celebrating the traditional importance of bread in local culture, the festival showcases many different types of local bread, with opportunities for learning, making and eating not only traditional bread but many traditional dishes.
directions=In Piazza Nicoletti, just outside the main gate of the city, going along Via Roma towards Perugia
content=A workshop providing custom-built fine violins, violas and violoncelli, as well as repairs and restoration for instruments of the violin family .

content=The restaurant "Cornaletto" boasts a forty-year experience in catering giving its guests the chance to taste dishes of the best Italian and Local Cuisine: starters, pasta, meat, cakes served according to set menus or à la carte options. Special care is given to the selection of raw materials with priority to small local products, such as for instance the “Fagiolina del Trasimeno” (French beans) used for soups, salads or as a base for stuffing...
content=Nice trattoria/restaurant underneath an old convent, which is in the process of being converted into a hotel. On weekends they serve pizza, which is excellent.
content=Traditional bar and gelateria located on one of the main squares of Corciano. Featuring home made ice cream and creative flavors.
content=– Via delle Rose 38/40 - Cap: 06074, Corciano (PG), Italy. •. The Hotel Colle della Trinitá is a four star hotel with large bedrooms and a swimming pool.

content=The friendly atmosphere and warm hospitality, and the peacefulness conveyed by its environment, distinguish Hotel El Patio. Its delicious cuisine, the sunset colours and the quietness of the countryside, are the ideal setting for a pleasant and relaxing stay in the Umbrian hills. The central position of the hotel, a few kilometres from the charming medieval town Corciano, enables guests to reach the most beautiful towns in Umbria within short time

Corciano is in the middle of the fascinating area of northern
. There are numerous cities to visit.
